body:
This is a bug.

Because the alias `test` matches the name of the field, `field.alt_alias` 

https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/cd50601172462b49cdf09e4d988906ba8f14af87/pydantic/env_settings.py#L43

Is `False`.

Shouldn't be too hard to fix. PR welcome, otherwise I'll fix when I get a chance.

Relatedly...

What drove the code sample above was a desire to change case semantics. Maybe there could be two options in config:

1. lower_case
2. upper_case (default)
3. case_insensitive

@samuelcolvin if you think you'd be open to this suggestion, I'll open a proper issue to further discuss it.

I'm very keen. I spend a lot of my time rewriting env variables to upper case.

The only slight problem I can see is that it's not entirely trivial to do the `case_insensitive` case, since env is case sensitive.

I guess the code could just do

```py
env2 = {k.lower(): v for k, v in os.environ.items()}
```
Then work with `env2`, but is there ever a chance that `os.environ` could be big enough to cause memory problems? I have no idea.

issue.title: Allow configuring env letter case rules for settings parser

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
Issue derived from https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/275

Currently `BaseSettings` defaults to looking for env variables in uppercase. This issue is a feature proposal to make this behaviour configurable.

The current workaround is to use the settings config class to set up aliases, e.g.:

```python
 class S(pydantic.BaseSettings):
      test:str

      class Config:
          fields = dict(test=dict(alias="test"))
```
However this is verbose and onerous to do (for the developer), if there are many such env vars.

It would be nice if the developer could do something like:

```python
 class S(pydantic.BaseSettings):
      class Config:
          letter_case = "lower" # or:  "upper" | "any"

      test:str
```

About this concern raised for case insensitive option https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/275#issuecomment-430336275.

* we could log a warning or raise an error at a certain configurable threshold of
    * env var count
    * or perhaps based on measured processing time exceeding configurable budget (e.g. 1ms)
* we could cache the calculation of `env2` (but probably the entire settings result would just be cached by the app)
* the env prefix could help reduce the amount of work needed to do

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

Fix for `Settings` the alias and field name are the same.

fix #275, replace #282
